clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Effectiveness Study of Transthoracic and Transesophageal Echocardiography in Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Effectiveness Study of Transthoracic and Transesophageal Echocardiography in Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: The Comparative Effectiveness Study of Transthoracic and Transesophageal Echocardiography in Stroke (CONTEST) aims at assessing the diagnostic value of transesophageal echocardiography (TEE) and transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) with regards to treatment consequences in patients with acute ischemic stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: For this purpose, the investigators will perform a prospective multicenter diagnostic comparative effectiveness study. Patients with acute stroke will be studied by both TTE and TEE. Patients with already defined stroke etiology and determined secondary prevention will be excluded from the trial. Treatment relevant diagnostic findings will be identified by a central endpoint adjudication committee. In order to demonstrate a hypothesized 2% absolute increase in the number of treatment relevant diagnostic findings by TEE as compared to TTE, 880 stroke patients will be enrolled in six German stroke centers. CONTEST will allow answering the question whether and for which group of stroke patients TEE is indicated in addition to TTE. By this, the study will provide evidence to guide justified recommendations for echocardiography in acute stroke patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of diagnostic findings that lead to a change in acute treatment or treatment for secondary prevention
primary_outcome.description: Treatment relevant diagnostic findings will be identified by a central endpoint adjudication committee comprising both cardiologists and neurologists.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of other major or minor risk factors for cardiac embolism detected by TTE or TEE.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with acute stroke in whom echocardiography is indicated will be studied by TTE and TEE.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- acute ischemic stroke or transitory ischemic attack (TIA)
- age ≥18 years
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with already defined stroke etiology and determined secondary prevention treatment strategy prior to echocardiography (e.g. atrial fibrillation, carotid artery stenosis, cervical artery dissection)
